name: CreativeWork
description: The most generic kind of creative work, including books, movies, photographs, software programs, etc.
title: CreativeWork

fields.name: about
fields.title: about
fields.description: The subject matter of the content.

fields.name: educationalAlignment
fields.title: educationalAlignment
fields.description: An alignment to an established educational framework.

fields.name: associatedMedia
fields.title: associatedMedia
fields.description: A media object that encodes this CreativeWork. This property is a synonym for encoding.

fields.name: funder
fields.title: funder
fields.description: A person or organization that supports (sponsors) something through some kind of financial contribution.

fields.name: position
fields.title: position
fields.description: The position of an item in a series or sequence of items.

fields.name: audio
fields.title: audio
fields.description: An embedded audio object.

fields.name: workExample
fields.title: workExample
fields.description: Example/instance/realization/derivation of the concept of this creative work. eg. The paperback edition, first edition, or eBook.

fields.name: provider
fields.title: provider
fields.description: The service provider, service operator, or service performer; the goods producer. Another party (a seller) may offer those services or goods on behalf of the provider. A provider may also serve as the seller.

fields.name: encoding
fields.title: encoding
fields.description: A media object that encodes this CreativeWork. This property is a synonym for associatedMedia.

fields.name: interactivityType
fields.title: interactivityType
fields.description: The predominant mode of learning supported by the learning resource. Acceptable values are 'active', 'expositive', or 'mixed'.

fields.name: accessibilitySummary
fields.title: accessibilitySummary
fields.description: A human-readable summary of specific accessibility features or deficiencies, consistent with the other accessibility metadata but expressing subtleties such as "short descriptions are present but long descriptions will be needed for non-visual users" or "short descriptions are present and no long descriptions are needed."

fields.name: character
fields.title: character
fields.description: Fictional person connected with a creative work.

fields.name: audience
fields.title: audience
fields.description: An intended audience, i.e. a group for whom something was created.

fields.name: sourceOrganization
fields.title: sourceOrganization
fields.description: The Organization on whose behalf the creator was working.

fields.name: isPartOf
fields.title: isPartOf
fields.description: Indicates a CreativeWork that this CreativeWork is (in some sense) part of.

fields.name: video
fields.title: video
fields.description: An embedded video object.

fields.name: publisher
fields.title: publisher
fields.description: The publisher of the creative work.

fields.name: publication
fields.title: publication
fields.description: A publication event associated with the item.

fields.name: text
fields.title: text
fields.description: The textual content of this CreativeWork.

fields.name: expires
fields.title: expires
fields.description: Date the content expires and is no longer useful or available. For example a VideoObject or NewsArticle whose availability or relevance is time-limited, or a ClaimReview fact check whose publisher wants to indicate that it may no longer be relevant (or helpful to highlight) after some date.

fields.name: contributor
fields.title: contributor
fields.description: A secondary contributor to the CreativeWork or Event.

fields.name: reviews
fields.title: reviews
fields.description: Review of the item.

fields.name: typicalAgeRange
fields.title: typicalAgeRange
fields.description: The typical expected age range, e.g. '7-9', '11-'.

fields.name: releasedEvent
fields.title: releasedEvent
fields.description: The place and time the release was issued, expressed as a PublicationEvent.

fields.name: educationalUse
fields.title: educationalUse
fields.description: The purpose of a work in the context of education; for example, 'assignment', 'group work'.

fields.name: contentLocation
fields.title: contentLocation
fields.description: The location depicted or described in the content. For example, the location in a photograph or painting.

fields.name: schemaVersion
fields.title: schemaVersion
fields.description: Indicates (by URL or string) a particular version of a schema used in some CreativeWork. For example, a document could declare a schemaVersion using an URL such as http://schema.org/version/2.0/ if precise indication of schema version was required by some application.

fields.name: accessibilityFeature
fields.title: accessibilityFeature
fields.description: Content features of the resource, such as accessible media, alternatives and supported enhancements for accessibility (WebSchemas wiki lists possible values).

fields.name: aggregateRating
fields.title: aggregateRating
fields.description: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.

fields.name: alternativeHeadline
fields.title: alternativeHeadline
fields.description: A secondary title of the CreativeWork.

fields.name: locationCreated
fields.title: locationCreated
fields.description: The location where the CreativeWork was created, which may not be the same as the location depicted in the CreativeWork.

fields.name: accessModeSufficient
fields.title: accessModeSufficient
fields.description: A list of single or combined accessModes that are sufficient to understand all the intellectual content of a resource. Expected values include:  auditory, tactile, textual, visual.

fields.name: temporalCoverage
fields.title: temporalCoverage
fields.description: The temporalCoverage of a CreativeWork indicates the period that the content applies to, i.e. that it describes, either as a DateTime or as a textual string indicating a time period in ISO 8601 time interval format. In the case of a Dataset it will typically indicate the relevant time period in a precise notation (e.g. for a 2011 census dataset, the year 2011 would be written "2011/2012"). Other forms of content e.g. ScholarlyArticle, Book, TVSeries or TVEpisode may indicate their temporalCoverage in broader terms - textually or via well-known URL. Written works such as books may sometimes have precise temporal coverage too, e.g. a work set in 1939 - 1945 can be indicated in ISO 8601 interval format format via "1939/1945".

fields.name: accountablePerson
fields.title: accountablePerson
fields.description: Specifies the Person that is legally accountable for the CreativeWork.

fields.name: spatialCoverage
fields.title: spatialCoverage
fields.description:
The spatialCoverage of a CreativeWork indicates the place(s) which are the focus of the content. It is a subproperty of
      contentLocation intended primarily for more technical and detailed materials. For example with a Dataset, it indicates
      areas that the dataset describes: a dataset of New York weather would have spatialCoverage which was the place: the state of New York.

fields.name: offers
fields.title: offers
fields.description: An offer to provide this item—for example, an offer to sell a product, rent the DVD of a movie, perform a service, or give away tickets to an event.

fields.name: editor
fields.title: editor
fields.description: Specifies the Person who edited the CreativeWork.

fields.name: discussionUrl
fields.title: discussionUrl
fields.description: A link to the page containing the comments of the CreativeWork.

fields.name: award
fields.title: award
fields.description: An award won by or for this item.

fields.name: copyrightHolder
fields.title: copyrightHolder
fields.description: The party holding the legal copyright to the CreativeWork.

fields.name: accessibilityHazard
fields.title: accessibilityHazard
fields.description: A characteristic of the described resource that is physiologically dangerous to some users. Related to WCAG 2.0 guideline 2.3 (WebSchemas wiki lists possible values).

fields.name: copyrightYear
fields.title: copyrightYear
fields.description: The year during which the claimed copyright for the CreativeWork was first asserted.

fields.name: awards
fields.title: awards
fields.description: Awards won by or for this item.

fields.name: recordedAt
fields.title: recordedAt
fields.description: The Event where the CreativeWork was recorded. The CreativeWork may capture all or part of the event.

fields.name: commentCount
fields.title: commentCount
fields.description: The number of comments this CreativeWork (e.g. Article, Question or Answer) has received. This is most applicable to works published in Web sites with commenting system; additional comments may exist elsewhere.

fields.name: fileFormat
fields.title: fileFormat
fields.description: Media type, typically MIME format (see IANA site) of the content e.g. application/zip of a SoftwareApplication binary. In cases where a CreativeWork has several media type representations, 'encoding' can be used to indicate each MediaObject alongside particular fileFormat information. Unregistered or niche file formats can be indicated instead via the most appropriate URL, e.g. defining Web page or a Wikipedia entry.

fields.name: inLanguage
fields.title: inLanguage
fields.description: The language of the content or performance or used in an action. Please use one of the language codes from the IETF BCP 47 standard. See also availableLanguage.

fields.name: accessibilityAPI
fields.title: accessibilityAPI
fields.description: Indicates that the resource is compatible with the referenced accessibility API (WebSchemas wiki lists possible values).

fields.name: interactionStatistic
fields.title: interactionStatistic
fields.description: The number of interactions for the CreativeWork using the WebSite or SoftwareApplication. The most specific child type of InteractionCounter should be used.

fields.name: contentRating
fields.title: contentRating
fields.description: Official rating of a piece of content—for example,'MPAA PG-13'.

fields.name: learningResourceType
fields.title: learningResourceType
fields.description: The predominant type or kind characterizing the learning resource. For example, 'presentation', 'handout'.

fields.name: accessMode
fields.title: accessMode
fields.description: The human sensory perceptual system or cognitive faculty through which a person may process or perceive information. Expected values include: auditory, tactile, textual, visual, colorDependent, chartOnVisual, chemOnVisual, diagramOnVisual, mathOnVisual, musicOnVisual, textOnVisual.

fields.name: material
fields.title: material
fields.description: A material that something is made from, e.g. leather, wool, cotton, paper.

fields.name: isFamilyFriendly
fields.title: isFamilyFriendly
fields.description: Indicates whether this content is family friendly.

fields.name: exampleOfWork
fields.title: exampleOfWork
fields.description: A creative work that this work is an example/instance/realization/derivation of.

fields.name: version
fields.title: version
fields.description: The version of the CreativeWork embodied by a specified resource.

fields.name: dateModified
fields.title: dateModified
fields.description: The date on which the CreativeWork was most recently modified or when the item's entry was modified within a DataFeed.

fields.name: mainEntity
fields.title: mainEntity
fields.description: Indicates the primary entity described in some page or other CreativeWork.

fields.name: genre
fields.title: genre
fields.description: Genre of the creative work, broadcast channel or group.

fields.name: keywords
fields.title: keywords
fields.description: Keywords or tags used to describe this content. Multiple entries in a keywords list are typically delimited by commas.

fields.name: author
fields.title: author
fields.description: The author of this content or rating. Please note that author is special in that HTML 5 provides a special mechanism for indicating authorship via the rel tag. That is equivalent to this and may be used interchangeably.

fields.name: isBasedOnUrl
fields.title: isBasedOnUrl
fields.description: A resource that was used in the creation of this resource. This term can be repeated for multiple sources. For example, http://example.com/great-multiplication-intro.html.

fields.name: timeRequired
fields.title: timeRequired
fields.description: Approximate or typical time it takes to work with or through this learning resource for the typical intended target audience, e.g. 'P30M', 'P1H25M'.

fields.name: translator
fields.title: translator
fields.description: Organization or person who adapts a creative work to different languages, regional differences and technical requirements of a target market, or that translates during some event.

fields.name: thumbnailUrl
fields.title: thumbnailUrl
fields.description: A thumbnail image relevant to the Thing.

fields.name: hasPart
fields.title: hasPart
fields.description: Indicates a CreativeWork that is (in some sense) a part of this CreativeWork.

fields.name: comment
fields.title: comment
fields.description: Comments, typically from users.

fields.name: review
fields.title: review
fields.description: A review of the item.

fields.name: license
fields.title: license
fields.description: A license document that applies to this content, typically indicated by URL.

fields.name: accessibilityControl
fields.title: accessibilityControl
fields.description: Identifies input methods that are sufficient to fully control the described resource (WebSchemas wiki lists possible values).

fields.name: encodings
fields.title: encodings
fields.description: A media object that encodes this CreativeWork.

fields.name: isBasedOn
fields.title: isBasedOn
fields.description: A resource that was used in the creation of this resource. This term can be repeated for multiple sources. For example, http://example.com/great-multiplication-intro.html.

fields.name: creator
fields.title: creator
fields.description: The creator/author of this CreativeWork. This is the same as the Author property for CreativeWork.

fields.name: publishingPrinciples
fields.title: publishingPrinciples
fields.description:
The publishingPrinciples property indicates (typically via URL) a document describing the editorial principles of an Organization (or individual e.g. a Person writing a blog) that relate to their activities as a publisher, e.g. ethics or diversity policies. When applied to a CreativeWork (e.g. NewsArticle) the principles are those of the party primarily responsible for the creation of the CreativeWork.

While such policies are most typically expressed in natural language, sometimes related information (e.g. indicating a funder) can be expressed using schema.org terminology.

fields.name: sponsor
fields.title: sponsor
fields.description: A person or organization that supports a thing through a pledge, promise, or financial contribution. e.g. a sponsor of a Medical Study or a corporate sponsor of an event.

fields.name: producer
fields.title: producer
fields.description: The person or organization who produced the work (e.g. music album, movie, tv/radio series etc.).

fields.name: mentions
fields.title: mentions
fields.description: Indicates that the CreativeWork contains a reference to, but is not necessarily about a concept.

fields.name: dateCreated
fields.title: dateCreated
fields.description: The date on which the CreativeWork was created or the item was added to a DataFeed.

fields.name: datePublished
fields.title: datePublished
fields.description: Date of first broadcast/publication.

fields.name: isAccessibleForFree
fields.title: isAccessibleForFree
fields.description: A flag to signal that the item, event, or place is accessible for free.

fields.name: headline
fields.title: headline
fields.description: Headline of the article.

fields.name: citation
fields.title: citation
fields.description: A citation or reference to another creative work, such as another publication, web page, scholarly article, etc.
